column4: May 18 Google  a unit of Alphabet Inc  unveiled a new hardware device called Google Home at the company's annual conference on Wednesday.

column3: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Google's parent Alphabet misses Wall Street view
column4: April 21 Google's parent Alphabet Inc  missed Wall Street targets for first-quarter profit and revenue on Thursday  driving shares of the Web search company down more than 4 percent in late trading on Thursday.

column3: Alphabet introduces home phone service
column4: Alphabet Inc's  high-speed internet service  Google Fiber  is introducing a home phone service  Fiber Phone  the company said on its blog on Tuesday.

column3: Alphabet puts robot-maker Boston Dynamics up for sale-Bloomberg
column4: March 17 Alphabet Inc has put Boston Dynamics  part of its robotics division  up for sale for lack of revenue potential  Bloomberg reported  citing people familiar with the plans.

column3: Google to urge Congress to help get self-driving cars on roads
column4: WASHINGTON  March 14 The head of Alphabet Inc's  Google self-driving car program will urge the U.S. Congress on Tuesday to grant national auto safety regulators new authority to speed the introduction of self-driving cars on American roads.

column3: U.S. auto safety agency seeking details of Google self-driving crash
column4: WASHINGTON  March 10 The top U.S. auto safety regulator said Thursday the agency is seeking additional details of a recent crash of an Alphabet Inc Google self-driving car in California.

column3: Alphabet's Project Fi exiting invite-only mode
column4: March 7 People across the United States interested in Alphabet Inc's wireless service  Project Fi  need not wait for an invite to sign up  starting Monday.

column3: Google Fiber's video subscriber growth surges 79 percent in 2015
column4: Alphabet Inc's much-talked about high-speed internet service  Google Fiber  had 53 000 video subscribers as of December end  up 79 percent from a year earlier  brokerage MoffettNathanson said  citing numbers from the U.S. Copyright Office.

column3: Google says will not participate in 2016 U.S. airwaves auction
column4: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO  Feb 12 Alphabet Inc's  Google will not participate in the U.S. Federal Communications Commission's upcoming auction of broadcast airwaves for wireless industry use  a spokeswoman told Reuters on Friday.

column3: UK lawmakers tell Google to come clean on tax
column4: LONDON UK lawmakers accused Google on Thursday of trying to fool Britons into believing it was a proponent of tax reform while remaining a prime beneficiary of loopholes in existing rules  and said if it was sincere the company would be more  transparent over its tax affairs. | Video

column3: Exclusive: In boost to self-driving cars  U.S. tells Google computers can qualify as drivers
column4: WASHINGTON/DETROIT U.S. vehicle safety regulators have said the artificial intelligence system piloting a self-driving Google car could be considered the driver under federal law  a major step toward ultimately winning approval for autonomous vehicles on the roads. | Video

column3: Google CEO Pichai receives stock grant worth about $199 million
column4: Google Chief Executive Sundar Pichai received restricted stock worth about $199 million  according to a regulatory filing by Google parent company Alphabet Inc  .

column3: Google search chief Singhal to quit  to be replaced by AI head
column4: Google parent Alphabet Inc  said Amit Singhal  the longtime chief of its Internet search business  will leave the company and be replaced by the head of the technology giant's artificial intelligence business.

column3: Google's search business chief Amit Singhal to leave
column4: Feb 3 Amit Singhal  the senior vice president of Google's Internet search business at Alphabet Inc  said he would leave at the end of the month after 15 years with the company.

column3: Alphabet profit sends shares up; overtakes Apple in value
column4: Alphabet Inc easily beat Wall Street's quarterly profit forecasts on Monday  helped by strong mobile advertising sales  sending the shares of Google's parent higher in after-hours trading to surpass Apple Inc as the most valuable U.S. company. | Video

column3: Alphabet surpasses Apple  now biggest traded US company
column4: Feb 1 Alphabet Inc surpassed Apple Inc  as the most valuable company in the United States in after-hours trading on Monday  knocking the iPhone maker from the top spot that it has held for the better part of four years.

column3: Alphabet changes results format to separate Google  other bets

column3: Google to pay 130 mln pounds in back taxes in UK - FT

column3: Amazon says its female workers paid equally as men
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc  under pressure from an activist shareholder to disclose its policies on gender pay equality  said on Wednesday its female employees earned as much as their male counterparts  according to a survey it recently conducted.

column3: Amazon exec weighs in on proposed Staples-Office Depot merger
column4: WASHINGTON An executive with Amazon.com Inc's  unit that sells office supplies to businesses gave testimony on Tuesday that appeared to bolster a U.S. regulator's wariness over a potential merger of Staples Inc  and Office Depot Inc .

column3: Staples' merger with Office Depot hangs in balance at court hearing
column4: WASHINGTON The fate of Staples Inc's  planned merger with Office Depot Inc   which U.S. antitrust regulators have sued to stop  depends in part on whether a district court judge decides that Amazon.com Inc  will soon become a behemoth in the office supply business.

column3: SEC says Amazon should allow shareholder vote on gender pay
column4: Amazon.com Inc  should allow shareholders to vote on a proposal on gender pay equality  the U.S. securities regulator decided this week in rejecting the retailer's request to omit the measure from its annual ballot.

column3: U.S. SEC says Amazon should allow shareholder vote on gender pay
column4: March 17 Amazon.com Inc should allow shareholders to vote on a proposal on gender pay equality  the U.S. securities regulator decided this week in rejecting the retailer's request to omit the measure from its annual ballot.

column3: Amazon Web Services says over 1 000 databases moved to cloud since Jan. 1
column4: March 15 Amazon.com Inc's cloud business  Amazon Web Services  said that more than 1 000 databases have been moved to the AWS cloud by customers since the beginning of the year.

column3: Amazon to start air delivery network with leasing deal
column4: Amazon.com Inc  said on Wednesday it had signed a deal to lease 20 Boeing  767 widebody freighter aircraft to handle more of its own deliveries in the United States.

column3: Amazon to restore encryption to Fire tablets after complaints
column4: Amazon.com Inc  said it plans to restore an encryption feature on its Fire tablets after customers and privacy advocates criticized the company for quietly removing the security option when it released its latest operating system.

column3: Amazon to restore encryption to Fire tablets after complaints
column4: March 5 Amazon.com Inc said it plans to restore an encryption feature on its Fire tablets after customers and privacy advocates criticized the company for quietly removing the security option when it released its latest operating system.

column3: U.S. tech companies unite behind Apple ahead of iPhone encryption ruling
column4: Tech industry leaders including Alphabet Inc's  Google  Facebook Inc   Microsoft Corp   AT&T  and more than two dozen other Internet and technology companies filed legal briefs on Thursday asking a judge to support Apple Inc  in its encryption battle with the U.S. government.

column3: Amazon drops encryption feature in Fire tablet software
column4: Amazon.com Inc has quietly dropped support for disk encryption on its Fire tablets  saying the feature that secures devices by scrambling data was not popular with customers.

column3: Amazon to attack UK grocery market with Morrisons deal
column4: LONDON Amazon has launched its biggest foray into food outside of the United States with a deal with British supermarket Morrisons to offer fresh and frozen goods to customers  in some places as quickly as under one hour. | Video

column3: Amazon to support Apple on fight over unlocking iPhone
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc  said on Thursday it will support Apple Inc's  fight against a magistrate's order  which requires it to help the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation break into a San Bernardino shooter's iPhone.

column3: Sears CEO cites U.S. minimum wage hikes  tax rules as burdens
column4: Sears Holdings Corp  has found it harder to compete  in part because of moves to increase the minimum wage and different tax rules for online retailers like Amazon.com Inc   Chief Executive Officer Eddie Lampert said on Thursday.

column3: Colorado can enforce its 'Amazon tax' law: U.S. appeals court
column4: A federal appeals court endorsed a Colorado law designed to make it easier for the state to collect sales taxes on out-of-state purchases made over the Internet.

column3: Amazon to open parcel locker network across Europe
column4: BERLIN  Feb 19 Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O wants to set up a network of parcel lockers across Europe to enable people to pick up their own orders as it seeks to widen delivery options and cut costs.

column3: Exclusive: Amazon expanding deliveries by its 'on-demand' drivers
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc  is quietly inviting drivers for its new "on-demand" delivery service to handle its standard packages  as the online retailer known for low prices and razor-thin profit margins looks to speed up delivery times and tamp down its growing multi-billion dollar logistics bill. | Video

column3: Amazon acquires Indian payments processor Emvantage
column4: MUMBAI Amazon.com Inc  said it has acquired Indian payments processor Emvantage Payments Pvt Ltd for an undisclosed sum.

column3: Amazon acquires Italy-based software firm
column4: Amazon Web Services  the cloud computing arm of Amazon.com Inc    said it has acquired NICE  a software developer for technical computing.

column3: Top Amazon executive to take two-year post with Italian prime minister
column4: ROME A top executive at Amazon.com  Diego Piacentini  is taking a two-year leave of absence to lead Italian Prime Minister Matteo Renzi's digital technology office  the company said on Wednesday.

column3: Amazon expands logistics reach in China
column4: SAN FRANCISCO/SHANGHAI  Feb 9 Amazon.com Inc  is aggressively expanding its logistics operations in China as part of a broader effort to control the rising cost of shipping billions of packages.

column3: Amazon renews credit card deal with JPMorgan
column4: Amazon.com Inc  the world's No. 1 online retailer  has renewed its long-running credit card relationship with JPMorgan Chase & Co  a spokesman for Amazon said on Thursday.

column3: General Growth Properties CEO clarifies comment on Amazon
column4: Feb 3 General Growth Properties Inc said on Wednesday that a statement concerning Amazon.com Inc  made by its chief executive  Sandeep Mathrani  was not intended to represent Amazon's plans.

column3: Amazon plans hundreds of physical bookstores - CNBC  citing DJ
column4: Feb 2 Amazon.com Inc is planning to open hundreds of brick-and-mortar bookstores  CNBC reported on Tuesday  citing a Dow Jones report.

column3: Amazon shares plunge as record profit still misses estimates
column4: Amazon.com Inc posted its most profitable quarter ever on Thursday but the world's No. 1 online retailer still managed to disappoint Wall Street by badly missing estimates  sending its shares down more than 13 percent in after-hours trading. | Video

column3: Amazon revenue rises 22 pct in holiday quarter
column4: Jan 28 E-commerce giant Amazon.com Inc  reported a 21.8 percent rise in quarterly revenue  helped by strong holiday-period shopping and robust growth in its cloud services business.

column3: Amazon steps up recruitment as it expands in Europe
column4: LONDON Online retailer Amazon plans to create several thousand jobs in Europe in 2016  more than 2 500 of which will be in Britain  stepping up its expansion in the region  it said on Friday.

column3: Amazon expands logistics reach with move into ocean shipping
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc's China arm has registered as an ocean freight forwarder  according to the U.S. Federal Maritime Commission  a move that will give it more control over shipping products from Chinese factories to U.S. shoppers.

column3: UPDATE 1-Amazon China approved to provide ocean freight services
column4: SAN FRANCISCO  Jan 14 Online retailer Amazon.com Inc's China division has registered as an ocean freight forwarder  according to the U.S. Federal Maritime Commission  a move which allows it to coordinate cargo shipments between China and the United States.

column3: US STOCKS-Wall St sells off late  S&P 500 falls below 1 900
column4: * Indexes down: Dow 2 pct  S&P 2.2 pct  Nasdaq 2.9 pct   (Updates to late afternoon)

column3: Amazon to launch portable version of Echo speaker - WSJ
column4: Amazon.com Inc expects to release a smaller  portable version of its voice-activated Echo speaker  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the plans.

column4: * Indexes down: Dow 2.4 pct  S&P 2.4 pct  Nasdaq 2.8 pct   (Updates to early afternoon)

column4: Amgen Inc and Novartis said late on Wednesday that episodic migraine sufferers reported fewer debilitating headaches per month after using the companies' investigational drug erenumab  compared to trial participants who got a placebo.

column3: Amgen's migraine drug succeeds in late-stage trial
column4: Amgen Inc  said on Wednesday its migraine treatment met the main goal of reducing monthly migraine days in patients with episodic migraine in a second late-stage study.

column3: Amgen cholesterol drug reduces artery-clogging plaque in study
column4: NEW ORLEANS Amgen Inc's potent new drug Repatha  when added to statin therapy  not only took "bad" LDL cholesterol down to extremely low levels but caused declines in artery-clogging plaque in a majority of high-risk heart patients after 18 months of treatment  according to data from a clinical trial.

column4: U.S. regulators have declined to approve Novartis' so-called biosimilar copy of Amgen's Neulasta drug that fights infections in cancer patients  the Swiss drugmaker said on Tuesday.

column4: Novartis AG's cheaper version of Amgen Inc's blockbuster arthritis drug Enbrel is highly similar in potency and safety to the original  according to a review by Food and Drug Administration staff.

column4: Amgen Inc's version of AbbVie Inc's Humira arthritis drug  the world's top-selling medicine  appears similar in potency and safety to the original product  U.S. Food and Drug Administration staff members said on Friday.

column3: U.S. top court rules for Amgen over employee lawsuit
column4: WASHINGTON The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday handed a victory to Amgen Inc by throwing out a ruling in favor of current and former employees who say they lost money by investing in the pharmaceutical company's own stock-ownership plan.

column3: Apple to cut iPhone production in first quarter of 2017: report

column3: Nokia files more patent suits against Apple

column4: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc's  new wireless headphones could be a problem for recyclers  according to an electronics firm that took apart the device to review its component parts.

column3: Apple AirPod headphones available for sale after two-month delay

column4: A German court has ruled against Apple Inc  in a case over video streaming patents  handing Kudelski's OpenTV unit a victory in its ongoing intellectual property licensing campaign against major technology companies.

column3: UPDATE 2-Apple: U.S. founders would be 'appalled' by DOJ iPhone request
column4: SAN FRANCISCO/WASHINGTON  March 15 The U.S. founding fathers "would be appalled" by a Department of Justice request to unlock an encrypted iPhone  Apple Inc said on Tuesday in its final brief before a court showdown next week.

column3: Apple 'raised technological barriers' to stop warrant in iPhone case: U.S. government
column4: The U.S. Justice Department on Thursday said Apple Inc's  rhetoric was "false" in a high-profile fight over the government's bid to unlock an encrypted iPhone belonging to one of the San Bernardino shooters.

column3: U.S. government calls Apple rhetoric 'false' in iPhone case
column4: March 10 The U.S. Justice Department on Thursday said Apple Inc's rhetoric was "false" in a high-profile fight over the government's bid to unlock an encrypted iPhone belonging to one of the San Bernardino shooters.

column3: Signs of life for Apple's stock as Wall St. eyes new iPhone
column4: SAN FRANCISCO After months of declines in Apple's  stock  sentiment appears to be mending as investors focus on steady earnings expectations and bet that the expected launch of a new iPhone will add badly-needed fuel to sputtering sales. | Video

column3: Justice Department asks judge to revisit NY iPhone case
column4: WASHINGTON The U.S. Justice Department on Monday sought to overturn a ruling which protects Apple from unlocking an iPhone in a New York drug case.

column3: Justice Department asks judge to reconsider NY iPhone case
column4: WASHINGTON The U.S. Justice Department on Monday resubmitted its case for Apple to unlock an encrypted iPhone belonging to a drug offender to a higher judge in the Eastern District of New York.

column3: Apple users targeted in first known Mac ransomware campaign
column4: BOSTON  March 6 Apple Inc customers were targeted by hackers over the weekend in the first campaign against Macintosh computers using a pernicious type of software known as ransomware  researchers with Palo Alto Networks Inc  told Reuters on Sunday.

column3: U.S. tech companies unite behind Apple ahead of iPhone encryption ruling
column4: Tech industry leaders including Alphabet Inc's  Google  Facebook Inc  Microsoft Corp  AT&T and more than two dozen other Internet and technology companies filed legal briefs on Thursday asking a judge to support Apple Inc in its encryption battle with the U.S. government.

column3: Apple supplier Broadcom to slash 1 900 jobs globally
column4: Chipmaker Broadcom Ltd  the company created following the merger of Avago and Broadcom  said it would cut about 1 900 jobs globally across its businesses.

column3: Apple should not try making a car on its own  Marchionne says
column4: GENEVA U.S. technology giant Apple should collaborate with carmakers to make a vehicle and use the expertise already available rather than attempt to do it on its own  Fiat Chrysler Chief Executive Sergio Marchionne said.

column3: U.S. attorney general worried encryption debate 'all about Apple'
column4: SAN FRANCISCO U.S. Attorney General Loretta Lynch said on Tuesday her Justice Department's court battle to force Apple Inc  to unlock an iPhone linked to one of the San Bernardino shooters ran the risk of becoming "all about Apple" and that the company should not be able to decide the broader encryption debate alone.

column3: Attorney General Lynch says hopes Apple will comply with court order
column4: WASHINGTON U.S. Attorney General Loretta Lynch said on Monday that she hopes Apple Inc.  will still comply with the court order by a federal judge in California to unlock the iPhone used by one of the San Bernardino shooters.

column3: Samsung wins appeal in patent dispute with Apple
column4: A U.S. appeals court on Friday overturned a $120 million jury verdict against Samsung  finally handing the South Korean smartphone maker a significant win in its longstanding patent feud with top rival Apple.

column3: UPDATE 1-Apple CEO Tim Cook commits to annual dividend raise
column4: Feb 26 Chief Executive Tim Cook said on Friday Apple Inc is committed to raising its dividend annually  a move designed to please investors but also a sign the world's most famous technology company may no longer be a growth stock.

column3: Apple calls FBI iPhone request 'unprecedented' in court filing
column4: Apple Inc on Thursday struck back in court against a U.S. government demand that it unlock an encrypted iPhone belonging to one of the San Bernardino shooters  arguing such a move would violate its free speech rights and override the will of Congress.

column3: UPDATE 1-Verizon supports 'strong encryption with no backdoors' -CEO
column4: NEW YORK  Feb 24 Verizon Communications Inc  supports "the availability of strong encryption with no backdoors " Chief Executive Lowell McAdam said on Wednesday  weighing in the showdown between Apple Inc and U.S. authorities over mobile device encryption.

column3: COLUMN-DOJ accuses Apple of 'misleading' in encryption fight: Frankel
column4: NEW YORK Feb 23 In Apple's depiction of its intensifying fight with the U.S. Justice Department over accessing data from the iPhone of accused San Bernardino shooter Syed Farook  the company is heroically battling in courts across the country for the principle of protecting the privacy of cellphone users  even if that principle requires Apple to oppose government requests to help investigators crack security on suspected criminals' phones.

column3: Exclusive: San Bernardino victims to oppose Apple on iPhone encryption
column4: Some victims of the San Bernardino attack will file a legal brief in support of the U.S. government's attempt to force Apple Inc to unlock the encrypted iPhone belonging to one of the shooters  a lawyer representing the victims said on Sunday.

column3: Trump calls for boycott until Apple unlocks shooter's phone
column4: PAWLEYS ISLAND  S.C. Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump called on Friday for a boycott of Apple Inc products until the tech company agreed to help the U.S. government unlock the cellphone of one of the killers in last year's San Bernardino  California  shooting.

column3: UPDATE 3-Trump calls for boycott until Apple unlocks shooter's phone
column4: PAWLEYS ISLAND  S.C.  Feb 19 Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump called on Friday for a boycott of Apple Inc products until the tech company agreed to help the U.S. government unlock the cellphone of one of the killers in last year's San Bernardino  California  shooting.

column3: Apple Pay takes on China's internet kings in mobile payments

column3: Factbox: What Apple and the U.S. government are fighting over
column4: Apple Inc  is resisting a federal court order that it help the U.S. government break into the iPhone 5c of Rizwan Farook  who along with his wife killed 14 people in a December shooting in San Bernardino  California  which the government has described as a terror attack.

column3: Icahn  Einhorn's Greenlight slash Apple stakes amid fourth-quarter share decline

column3: Apple to launch new iPhone  iPad in March: 9to5mac

column3: Japan Display says will swing to January-March op loss as Apple orders sag

column3: Apple ordered to pay $625 mln in patent dispute with VirnetX

column3: Apple ordered to pay $625 mln in patent dispute with VirnetX

Since then  Instagram has attracted more than 200 000 advertisers  the company announced Wednesday  a clear sign of its potential for significantly contributing to Facebook’s revenue.

column3: 3G will take another bite of Corporate America

Their next target should be Mondelez  the $66 billion food conglomerate that failed to coax chocolate-maker Hershey into a sale in 2016. A deal will require some unusual ingredients.

column3: Abbott  Alere agree to mediate merger dispute

column3: Delaware judge expedites Alere lawsuit against Abbott
column4: NEW YORK/WILMINGTON  Del. A Delaware judge on Friday granted a motion to expedite Alere Inc's  lawsuit against Abbott Laboratories   which seeks to ensure that Abbott lives up to the terms of its $5.8 billion takeover of the diagnostics company  representatives for Alere said.

column3: Alere lawsuit accuses Abbott of 'buyer's remorse' in proposed merger
column4: Alere Inc  alleges Abbott Laboratories  is trying to stymie its planned $5.8 billion takeover of the diagnostics company by purposefully delaying key submissions to anti-trust regulators  according to a lawsuit made public on Tuesday.

column3: Whiplashed investors stay skittish about St. Jude
column4: One day after a short seller claimed that St. Jude Medical Inc's  heart implants are vulnerable to deadly cyber attacks  investors appear most concerned about whether the accusation will derail St. Jude's $24 billion planned deal for Abbott Labs  to buy it.St. Jude's stock at one point fell around 3 percent on Friday  though it ended the day slightly up  following a drop of around 5 percent on Thursday after Muddy Waters Capital leveled the accusation agains

column3: Abbott sales beat on higher demand for medical devices
column4: Abbott Laboratories reported better-than-expected quarterly sales and profit as strong sales in its medical device business more than made up for the hit from an economic turmoil in Venezuela.

column3: Brazil's Banco Bradesco raising age limit to keep CEO Trabuco -source
column4: SAO PAULO  Sept 5 Shareholders of Brazil's Banco Bradesco SA will vote on Oct. 7 on a proposal to change the age limit for its chief executive to 67 years from the current 65 years  the bank said in a securities filing on Monday.

column3: Brazil's Bradesco denies it plans to name new CEO
column4: BRASILIA  Aug 1 Bradesco SA  Brazil's No. 2 private-sector bank  on Monday denied reports it was planning to pick a new chief executive officer in the wake of a corruption scandal.

column3: Bradesco shares sink as outlook for loan-loss provisions worsens
column4: SAO PAULO Shares in Banco Bradesco SA sank on Thursday as a grimmer outlook for loan-loss provisions this year reignited concerns that a harsh recession and a deluge of refinancing requests may hamper profits at Brazil's No. 3 listed lender.

column3: Brazil's Bradesco says board approved share buyback
column4: BRASILIA  June 24 Brazilian lender Banco Bradesco SA said in a securities filing on Friday that its board approved plans to buy back as many as 15 million shares by June 26  2017.

column3: Bradesco wins Brazil approval for $5.2 billion purchase of HSBC unit
column4: SAO PAULO/BRASILIA Brazil's antitrust watchdog on Wednesday approved Banco Bradesco SA's purchase of HSBC Holdings Plc's  local unit with some conditions  marking the latest departure of a foreign lender from one of the world's most concentrated banking markets.

column3: Banco Bradesco faces shareholder lawsuit in U.S.
column4: NEW YORK Banco Bradesco SA was sued on Friday in a U.S. court by shareholders who accused the Brazilian lender of fraudulently concealing its involvement in a bribery scheme  its alleged effort to avoid a 3 billion Brazilian reais ($850.89 million) tax fine  and weaknesses in its internal controls.

column3: Bradesco CEO Trabuco faces accusations in Brazil tax probe
column4: SAO PAULO Brazil's federal police accused Banco Bradesco SA  Chief Executive Officer Luiz Carlos Trabuco and two senior executives on Tuesday of plotting to avoid a 3 billion-real ($828 million) tax fine  the latest episode of alleged white-collar crime in Latin America's largest economy.

column3: Itaú loses ground to Bradesco as outlooks for Brazil banks diverge
column4: SAO PAULO The premium in the shares of Brazilian lender Itaú Unibanco Holding SA over smaller rival Banco Bradesco SA narrowed on Wednesday as investors fretted that Itaú faces a tougher time coping with a painful recession.

column3: Bradesco sees provisions within goal despite rising Brazil defaults
column4: SAO PAULO Banco Bradesco SA expects loan-loss provisions to end the year within target even if defaults climbed further  executives said on Thursday  trying to allay concerns that a harsh recession will lead Brazil's third-largest listed bank to accelerate loan refinancings for troubled individual and corporate borrowers.

column3: Brazil authorizes Bradesco's $2.2 billion capital increase plan
column4: SAO PAULO Banco Bradesco SA  said on Monday it had received central bank permission to raise up to 8 billion reais ($2.2 billion) in fresh capital through a share offering.

column3: Bradesco closes in on Itaú amid diverging Brazil outlook
column4: SAO PAULO  Feb 5 Itaú Unibanco Holding SA   Brazil's largest private-sector bank  has for years traded at a premium to rival Banco Bradesco SA but many investors are betting the gap will narrow amid sharply diverging outlooks from the lenders.

column3: Brazil's Banco Bradesco proposes $2 bln capital increase
column4: SAO PAULO  Feb 3 Brazil's Banco Bradesco SA   the country's second largest private bank  proposed on Wednesday a capital increase of 8 billion reais ($2.05 billion) using its own reserves and granting new shares to current shareholders free of charge  the bank said in a regulatory filing.

column3: Worst Brazil default cases already happened  Bradesco CFO says
column4: SAO PAULO  Jan 29 Many of Brazil's biggest corporate loan defaults cases have already happened and been dealt with  a senior executive at giant private-sector lender Banco Bradesco said on Friday  underscoring a prudent tack on loan book quality as the nation struggles with a deep recession.

column3: UPDATE 3-Bradesco's cautious targets underpin extent of Brazil woes
column4: SAO PAULO  Jan 28 Banco Bradesco SA  Brazil's No. 2 private sector bank  expects loan book growth to slow and loan-loss provisions to rise significantly this year  highlighting the headwinds facing Latin America's largest economy.

column3: Ex-Barclays trader stood to gain $172.50 bonus from alleged Libor fixing  court hears
column4: LONDON An ex-Barclays trader accused of fixing a key financial benchmark for personal gain stood to earn a bonus of only $172.50 for his role in alleged rate-rigging in 2007  a London court heard on Friday.

column3: Ex-Barclays trader alleged top bosses knew of Libor requests  London court hears
column4: A former trader at Barclays  one of five on trial on charges of conspiracy to manipulate financial benchmark interest rates  alleged that top bosses at the bank approved and condoned the practice  a London court heard on Thursday.

column3: Ex-Barclays traders earned substantial bonuses  Libor trial hears
column4: LONDON Former Barclays bankers standing trial on charges of conspiracy to manipulate financial benchmark interest rates earned substantial bonuses in jobs in which money "was the name of the game"  a London court heard on Wednesday.

column4: March 30 Barclays Plc has hired Bank of America 's Eric Biddle as an investment banker to retail and consumer companies  according to people familiar with the matter.

column3: MOVES-Senior banker Boath leaves Barclays
column4: LONDON  March 29 (IFR) - Senior Barclays investment banker Richard Boath  who sued the bank in a dispute over pay and was one of the senior people investigated by Britain's financial watchdog over a 2008 fundraising  has left the bank.

column3: Timeline: U.S. court denies Barclays appeal in power manipulation case
column4: March 14 - The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit last week denied an appeal by Barclays Plc in part because the district court's order was not a final decision.

column3: Exclusive: Morocco's Attijariwafa Bank plans bid for Barclays' Egypt business
column4: DUBAI Attijariwafa Bank   Morocco's largest bank by assets  plans to bid for the Egyptian operations of Barclays   a senior executive told Reuters on Tuesday.

column3: MOVES-Barclays hires investment bankers from boutique CMC Capital
column4: LONDON  March 7 Barclays has hired a team of bankers from boutique firm CMC Capital  including founding partner Carlo Calabria  to beef up its investment banking team in Europe  the British lender said on Monday.

column3: MOVES-Mizuho Bank Americas hires chief risk officer from Barclays
column4: March 3 Mizuho Bank Americas  part of Japan-based Mizuho Financial Group Inc  appointed Eric Yoss as chief risk officer.

column3: Barclays to exit Africa in 'transatlantic' makeover
column4: LONDON Barclays Plc will sell its Africa business as part of a plan by new Chief Executive Jes Staley to simplify the bank's structure and seek higher shareholder returns  it said after reporting a 2 percent profit drop and slashing its dividend. | Video

column3: UK's FTSE rises as LSE rally offsets Barclays slump
column4: LONDON  March 1 Britain's top equity index rose on Tuesday as a possible counter-bid lifted shares in the London Stock Exchange  offsetting drops for Barclays  Ashtead and Glencore.

column3: Barclays must face electricity price-fixing lawsuit in U.S.
column4: NEW YORK A U.S. judge ordered Barclays Plc to face a proposed class-action lawsuit in which a California water utility accused the British bank of illegally manipulating electricity prices in the western United States  causing purchasers to overpay.

column3: Barclays to wind down African business -FT
column4: Feb 26 Barclays PLC Chief Executive Jes Staley has decided to shut the bank's operations in Africa  the Financial Times said on Friday  citing sources familiar with the matter.

column3: Bamford steps down as Barclays rejigs syndicate
column4: LONDON  Feb 22 (IFR) - Barclays is folding its debt syndicate function into its banking department  a move that will see current head of global fixed income syndicate  Mark Bamford  leave the bank after 10 years  according to an internal memo seen by IFR.

column3: Barclays to pay $50 million to end U.S. currency rigging lawsuit
column4: By Jonathan Stempel Barclays Plc agreed to pay $50 million to settle a U.S. lawsuit claiming it rigged its foreign exchange trading system to reject client orders that would be unprofitable for the British bank.

column3: FOREX-Yen on track for strongest week since late 2008
column4: LONDON  Feb 12 The yen was on track on Friday for its biggest weekly gain against the dollar since late 2008 as worries about global growth supported inflows to safe-haven assets  although the currency's recent surge stalled in London trade.

column3: REFILE-MOVES-Barclays names new heads of global DCM

column3: BHP Billiton investors sue in U.S. over Brazil dam disaster

column3: U.S. says ferroalloy imports from Australia sold at 12.03 pct dumping margin

column3: U.S. Navy's 'unfunded priorities' list has Boeing  Lockheed fighters
column4: SAN FRANCISCO Included on a list of "unfunded priorities" the U.S. Navy prepared for Congress are 14 Boeing Co F/A-18E/F Super Hornets valued at $1.5 billion and two Lockheed Martin Corp F-35C jets worth $270 million  according to U.S. defense officials.

column3: Boeing exec says new mid-market is 'tough business case'
column4: PHOENIX  March 1 Boeing Co is studying various options for an aircraft in the middle of the aircraft market  but developing an all-new design from scratch poses a "tough business case " Marketing Vice President Randy Tinseth said.

column3: BRIEF-Boeing exec says new jet programs on track
column4: Feb 29 Boeing Marketing Vice-President Randy Tinseth at Istat air finance conference:

column3: RPT-Proposed Honeywell-United Tech deal could result in greater pricing power
column4: NEW YORK  Feb 28 Honeywell International Inc's  proposal to buy rival United Technologies Corp  would create an industrial giant bigger than aircraft makers Boeing Co or Airbus Group  potentially changing the balance of power between manufacturer and supplier.

column3: Exclusive: Boeing plans layoffs for airplane engineers
column4: NEW YORK Boeing Co said on Friday that it is considering layoffs of airplane engineers  a plan that it said may cause it to reorganize or consolidate its engineering teams  according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.

column3: New Northrop bomber to be designated B-21 -U.S. Air Force
column4: WASHINGTON U.S. Air Force Secretary Deborah James on Friday unveiled the first image of a new Northrop Grumman Corp long-range bomber and said it would be designated the B-21  as losing bidder Boeing Co said it would forego further challenges.

column3: UPDATE 2-Boeing to skip legal challenge to Northrop bomber deal-source
column4: WASHINGTON  Feb 25 Boeing Co has told senior U.S. Air Force leaders that it will not take legal action challenging an $80 billion long-range bomber contract awarded to Northrop Grumman Corp  two sources familiar with the decision said on Thursday.

column3: Boeing names Caret to replace head of defense unit
column4: WASHINGTON  Feb 24 Boeing Co on Wednesday named long-time company executive Leanne Caret to replace Chris Chadwick as the head of its defense division.

column3: UPDATE 1-FAA proposes fix for Boeing 787 Dreamliner
column4: Feb 23 The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration proposed a new airworthiness directive (AD) for some of Boeing Co's 787-8 Dreamliner aircraft after a report found a defect in a wing component.

column3: United orders 25 more Boeing 737s worth $2 billion: sources
column4: PARIS Boeing Co  has won an order for 25 current-generation Boeing 737 aircraft from United Continental Holdings Inc   beating rivals including Canada's Bombardier Inc  for the second time in a month  two industry sources said on Monday.

column3: Boeing gets U.S. license to talk deals with Iranian airlines
column4: Boeing Co said on Friday that the United States gave it a license to hold talks with airlines in Iran about buying jetliners  but said it would need additional U.S. approval to make sales.

column3: Boeing engineers overwhelmingly back new labor contracts
column4: Boeing Co's  engineers' union ratified six-year labor contracts by a wide margin on Wednesday  a vote that ensures stability during a period when the planemaker is bringing out new versions of its two most profitable jetliners  the 737 and the 777.

column3: Boeing CEO sees no downturn in commercial airplane cycle
column4: Boeing Co's  top executive reaffirmed on Wednesday the company's outlook for strong growth and cash flow over the next five years  dismissing investor concerns that the aviation business cycle is on the cusp of a downturn.

column3: U.S. agency rejects Boeing protest of Northrop bomber contract
column4: WASHINGTON A U.S. government agency on Tuesday rejected a protest filed by Boeing Co and Lockheed Martin Corp against a multibillion-dollar bomber contract awarded to Northrop Grumman Corp by the U.S. Air Force in October.

column3: Boeing sees new aircraft demand worth $550 billion in Southeast Asia over 20 years
column4: SINGAPORE Southeast Asia requires 3 750 new aircraft worth $550 billion in 20 years from 2015  a senior Boeing  executive told a press conference ahead of the Singapore Airshow that starts on Tuesday.

column3: Boeing  U.S. Navy working on fixes for F/A-18 pilot oxygen issues
column4: WASHINGTON Boeing Co  and the U.S. Navy this week said they had implemented a series of measures to address a rise in health issues reported by Boeing F/A-18 and EA-18G fighter jet pilots  including a redesign of the jets' oxygen generation system.

column3: Boeing uses an accounting method that others have left behind
column4: NEW YORK The type of accounting Boeing Co uses to reflect the enormous upfront costs of building its jetliners is unusual among large U.S. corporations and leaves a lot of judgment up to the company  accounting experts said.

column3: Boeing shares drop on accounting fears  competitive threats
column4: Boeing Co  shares plunged as much as 11 percent on Thursday  hit by a report that regulators are probing the company's accounting and by mounting concerns about slowing sales and production.

column3: Boeing to cut commercial airplane jobs to reduce costs
column4: SEATTLE  Feb 10 Boeing Co said on Wednesday it will cut jobs at its commercial airplane unit as part of an ongoing effort to reduce costs.

column3: Factbox: What deal on CO2 standards means for Airbus  Boeing jets
column4: Global aviation leaders agreed on Monday to the world's first carbon dioxide emissions standards for new and existing plane programs starting in 2020  three sources familiar with the matter said.

column3: Washington lawmakers nix bill linking tax breaks to Boeing jobs
column4: SEATTLE Washington state lawmakers voted down a bill on Friday that would have forced Boeing  to keep a minimum number of jobs in the state in exchange for receiving billions of dollars in tax breaks.    The 7-8 vote in the state's House Finance committee means the measure will not advance to a floor vote.

column3: State lawmakers nix bill linking aerospace tax breaks to Boeing jobs
column4: SEATTLE  Feb 5 Washington state lawmakers voted down a bill on Friday that would have linked $8.9 billion in state aerospace industry tax breaks to Boeing Co  employment levels.   (Reporting by Alwyn Scott; Editing by Leslie Adler)

column3: Boeing focuses on early 737 MAX delivery: CFO
column4: SEATTLE Boeing Co said on Wednesday it was working to deliver its new 737 MAX single-aisle aircraft ahead of schedule next year  provided the company can complete testing on time and customers are ready to receive it.

column3: Spirit AeroSystems forecasts profit largely above Street
column4: Aircraft parts maker Spirit AeroSystems Holdings Inc  forecast 2016 profit largely above Wall Street expectations despite Boeing Co   its biggest customer  expecting to deliver fewer planes this year.

column3: Boeing wins contract to build new Air Force One presidential jets
column4: WASHINGTON Boeing Co  has won a contract to start preliminary work on a new fleet of Air Force One presidential aircraft based on its 747-8 jumbo jet  the Pentagon said on Friday.

column3: Boeing awarded $2.5 billion contract for 20 P-8A maritime surveillance planes
column4: WASHINGTON Boeing Co  has won a contract worth $2.5 billion to build 20 more P-8A maritime surveillance aircraft  the Pentagon announced on Thursday.

column3: Boeing shares slide; investors brace for slow deliveries  profit hit
column4: SEATTLE Boeing Co braced investors on Wednesday for a rough 2016  forecasting lower-than-expected earnings and fewer plane deliveries largely because of production changes needed to boost output later in the decade  news that sent its stock down sharply.

column3: Boeing sets first flight of 737 MAX for Friday
column4: SEATTLE Boeing Co  said it had tentatively scheduled the first flight of its newest airplane  the 737 MAX  for Friday  a sign that it is on schedule for another key milestone for its top-selling plane.

column3: Iran marks comeback with talks to buy 160 European planes
column4: TEHRAN Iran unveiled an expanded shopping list for more than 160 European planes - including 8 superjumbos - and dangled another big order in front of Boeing  at Tehran's first major post-sanctions business gathering on Sunday.

column3: Boeing to cut 747-8 production in half as demand slows
column4: Boeing Co  said on Thursday it will cut production of its 747-8 jumbo jet in half and take a $569 million charge in the fourth quarter as it faces dwindling sales.

column3: Boeing sets sights on $2 billion United small jets order: sources
column4: PARIS/NEW YORK United Airlines is close to deciding an order for about 30 small jets worth around $2 billion at list prices and Boeing looks well placed to win at least part of the deal after undercutting smaller rivals  industry sources said.

column3: Boeing and engineering union reach tentative contract deal
column4: NEW YORK  Boeing Co and its engineering union said on Wednesday they reached a tentative agreement to extend the labor contract for more than 20 000 workers.

column3: UPDATE 2-Airbus shrugs off China concerns after outselling Boeing
column4: PARIS  Jan 12 Europe's Airbus is unperturbed by China's financial turmoil  sticking to robust demand forecasts on Tuesday after beating arch-rival Boeing  in the annual tally of global aircraft orders  despite failing to close a gap on total deliveries with the world's largest jetmaker.

column3: Boeing delivers 762 jetliners in 2015  topping forecast
column4: NEW YORK Boeing Co  said on Thursday that it delivered 762 jetliners in 2015  exceeding its target of 755 to 760 planes as the company entered its centenary year.

column3: Boeing wins $855 million contract for T-38C logistics support
column4: Boeing Co  has been awarded a contract worth $855 million to provide "avionics component integration and contractor logistics support" for T-38C aircraft  the Pentagon said on Monday.

column4: Boston Scientific Corp has asked the U.S. Supreme Court to overturn a $308 million Maryland state court jury verdict in a case over a patent licensing deal for implantable defibrillators  arguing that the state court ignored established patent law.

column4: Medical device maker Edwards Lifesciences Corp has filed claims that rival Boston Scientific Corp's new heart valve replacement system  which is not yet for sale in the U.S.  infringes several of Edwards' patents.

column4: Boston Scientific Corp reported a higher-than-expected quarterly profit and raised its full-year revenue forecast  helped by strong sales of new devices for heart patients.

column3: Boston Scientific sues Edwards over heart valve replacement patents
column4: Boston Scientific Corp has sued a rival medical device company alleging that its replacement heart valve and several related products infringe Boston Scientific patents.

column3: Boston Scientific says suspends Watchman FLX sales in Europe
column4: Boston Scientific Corp on Monday said it has temporarily stopped selling a newer version of its Watchman atrial fibrillation treatment in Europe due to a higher-than-expected rate of embolisms associated with the implant.

column3: Heart device maker Boston Scientific's sales miss estimates
column4: Heart device maker Boston Scientific Corp's  quarterly revenue fell just shy of Wall Street expectations as sales in its second-biggest unit fell  sending its shares down as much as 6 percent.

column3: Australia's Woolworths sells petrol chain to BP for $1.3 billion
column4: SYDNEY Australia's top grocer Woolworths Ltd  said on Wednesday it will sell its chain of petrol stations to BP plc  for A$1.8 billion ($1.3 billion)  the latest disposal in a bid to return the company's focus to its core supermarket business.

column3: Azerbaijan extends BP's deal for giant oilfields until 2050
column4: Oil major BP has agreed with Azerbaijan to extend a contract to develop the country's biggest fields by a quarter of a century to 2050 in a move to unlock billions of dollars of fresh investments in the Caspian Sea deposits.

column3: BP splashes out on deals to beef up oil  gas reserves
column4: LONDON BP  on Monday agreed to buy stakes in gas-heavy exploration areas off the coast of Mauritania and Senegal from Kosmos   days after announcing the long-awaited renewal of an onshore oil concession in Abu Dhabi.

column3: Slack data management exposed BP to high safety risk: leaked report
column4: LONDON BP's  refining operations are exposed to high safety risks that can lead to deadly accidents and pollution as a result of slack data management and a lack of investment  according to a leaked internal report from 2015.

column3: Exclusive: In mammoth task  BP sends almost three million barrels of U.S. oil to Asia
column4: SINGAPORE Oil major BP  is shipping almost three million barrels of U.S. crude to customers across Asia  pioneering a lengthy and complex operation likely to become more popular after OPEC last week announced deep production cuts.

column3: BP acquires Repsol's stake in Tangguh LNG project
column4: LONDON British oil company BP has acquired Spanish group Repsol's 3.06 percent stake in the Tangguh liquefied natural gas (LNG) project in Indonesia for $313 million dollars  a BP spokesman said on Monday.

column3: BP approves $9 billion Mad Dog project in Gulf  a first since spill
column4: LONDON Oil major BP has approved a $9-billion investment in its Mad Dog project in the Gulf of Mexico  its first major new platform in the region since a 2010 explosion at its Macondo well led to the worst offshore disaster in U.S. history.

column3: BP Whiting refinery restarts crude unit after overhaul: source
column4: HOUSTON BP Plc restarted the second-largest crude distillation unit at the company's 413 500 barrel-per-day (bpd) Whiting  Indiana  refinery overnight  a source familiar with plant operations said on Monday.

column3: BP buys stake in Eni's giant Zohr gas field offshore Egypt
column4: MILAN/LONDON BP  has agreed to buy 10 percent of Eni's  Shorouk concession offshore Egypt  which includes the giant Zohr gas field  for $375 million  joining other oil majors in increasing bets on the growing gas market.

column3: Canadian refiner signs new crude supply contract with Lukoil: source
column4: NEW YORK NARL Refining has inked a new crude supply deal with Russian oil concern Lukoil at its remote Eastern Canadian refinery  a source said  ending a tumultuous relationship with oil major BP PLC that landed the pair in U.S. federal court.

column3: Exclusive: BP ring-fences CEO Dudley from Iran decision-making
column4: LONDON BP has created a new executive committee to explore business in Iran which will exclude its American chief executive Bob Dudley in a bid to avoid potential violations of U.S. sanctions still in place.

column3: BP to cut as many as 80 salaried jobs at Indiana refinery
column4: HOUSTON BP Plc plans to cut between 50 and 80 salaried positions at the company's 413 500-barrel-per-day refinery in Whiting  Indiana  a company spokesman said on Wednesday.

column3: BP inks deal for General Electric oilfield data service
column4: BP PLC  said on Tuesday it will use a new digital solution by General Electric Co  designed to improve the efficiency and safety of its offshore oil platforms by predicting equipment breakdowns before they occur.

column4: * Has signed a purchase agreement with BP to buy its bulk storage fuel terminal in Belfast  Northern Ireland

column3: BP sells U.S. crude oil to Thailand  Australia for first time: sources

column3: BP General Council Bondy to leave at year end
column4: LONDON  Oct 24 BP's General Council Rupert Bondy will step down at the end of the year after eight years in office during which he oversaw the legal battles surrounding the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill  a company spokesman said on Monday.

column3: Marathon suit attempt to renegotiate Texas City purchase terms: BP
column4: BP Plc  on Tuesday said it would vigorously defend itself against a federal civil suit by Marathon Petroleum Corp  alleging that it had failed to deliver a Texas oil refinery and three products terminals in the condition promised under a $2.4-billion sales agreement signed in 2012.

column3: BP sells Sunbury office building for 360 million pounds: industry sources
column4: LONDON BP has sold its biggest office building in Britain to a local council for an estimated 360 million pounds ($468 million)  according to industry sources  and will remain in the premises as a tenant.

column3: 5th Circuit nixes ERISA claims against BP tied to Deepwater Horizon spill
column4: BP PLC did not violate a federal law governing employee benefit plans by continuing to invest in company stock despite knowing about safety risks in the time before the deadly Deepwater Horizon oil spill  a U.S. appeals court said on Tuesday.

column4: CAIRO BP has signed amendments to the Temsah  Ras El Barr and Nile Delta Offshore concessions in Egypt  allowing for the development of the Nooros field  the company said on Tuesday.

column4: HOUSTON A tanker carrying over 1 million barrels of U.S. light crude finished discharging on Monday after a 100-day wait related to payment delays from Venezuela's state-run PDVSA to oil major BP Plc  according to Thomson Reuters vessel tracking data.

column3: BP unit selling up to $261 million stake in Castrol India: termsheet
column4: MUMBAI Castrol Ltd  a unit of BP Plc   is selling an up to $261 million stake in Castrol India Ltd  in a block trade on Tuesday  according to a termsheet seen by Reuters.

column4: FRANKFURT/LONDON At least three leading chemical companies are set to vie for BP's stake in Chinese petrochemicals joint venture SECCO which could fetch more than $2 billion  sources close to the process said.

column3: INTERVIEW-BP has no plans to raise annual investments this decade -CEO
column4: BUENOS AIRES  Sept 14 BP does not plan to increase annual investments this decade but still expects to bring nine new projects online in 2017 as it focuses on improving efficiency  Chief Executive Bob Dudley said in an interview on Wednesday.

column4: HOUSTON - Venezuela's cash-strapped state oil giant PDVSA will end up paying at least $130 million more than it planned for crude imports after payment delays to major BP Plc  according to internal documents analyzed by Reuters.

column4: MUMBAI Castrol India Ltd  said on Friday it was not aware of any stake sale in the company by Castrol Ltd  a unit of oil major BP Plc   and said recent news reports that such a transaction would take place were based on market speculation.

column4: MUMBAI An up to $261 million share sale in Castrol India Ltd  by BP Plc  due to take place on Wednesday according to a term sheet seen by Reuters had not taken place as of the end of the trading day  according to exchange data.

column3: BP eyeing sale of U.K. oil terminals and pipeline stake -Telegraph

column3: BP unlikely to invest in Saudi Aramco IPO: CEO

column3: BP and Det norske agree $1.3 billion Norwegian oil merger
column4: OSLO/LONDON Oil companies BP  and Det norske  have agreed to merge their Norwegian businesses in a $1.3 billion all-share deal to cut costs  challenge Statoil's  dominance of the local industry and look for more acquisitions.

column3: UPDATE 1-BP  Eni announce new gas discovery off Egyptian coast
column4: LONDON  June 9 Energy majors BP and Eni  on Thursday announced a significant natural gas discovery off the Egyptian coast.

column4: LONDON The world's oil reserves were unchanged in 2015 despite a sharp drop in investment and exploration after the collapse in crude prices  BP said in its benchmark industry report.

column3: BP-Prumo's NFX starts importing maritime diesel to Brazil's Acu port
column4: SAO JOAO DA BARRA  Brazil  June 7 NFX  the joint venture between oil company BP and port operator Prumo Logistica  has begun importing maritime fuel to the Brazilian port of Acu  the company said in a statement on Tuesday.

column3: BP agrees to pay $175 mln to settle claims with shareholders
column4: BP Plc agreed on Thursday to pay $175 million to shareholders who brought a class-action lawsuit that accused the oil company of misleading them by understating the severity of the 2010 oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico.

column3: BP's oil search strategy shrinks with budget cuts

column3: U.S. Supreme Court rejects appeal in shareholder suit against BP

column4: LUANDA The managing director of Chevron's Angola subsidiary has said he supports the direction state oil firm is taking after  President Jose Eduardo dos Santos appointed his daughter to head the company.

column3: U.S. government suspends enrollment in Cigna Medicare Advantage  drug plans
column4: The U.S. government has suspended new enrollment in Cigna Corp's Medicare Advantage health insurance and prescription drug plans  saying Cigna had "widespread and systemic failures" that prevented patients from accessing medical services.    The government said Cigna did not handle complaints and grievances properly from patients who had been denied coverage for health benefits or drugs  according to a Jan. 21 letter from its regulator  the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid.

column3: Credit Suisse eyes bigger share of private banking in Asia
column4: HONG KONG  May 12 Credit Suisse  which saw a pickup in inflows of net new money into its Asia Pacific private banking unit last quarter  plans to hire more staff to build on that momentum in a market buffeted by slowing economies and cut-throat competition.

column3: MOVES-Credit Suisse taps Lee for middle market M&A
column4: NEW YORK  May 11 (IFR) - Credit Suisse named Haidee Lee head of sellside M&A Americas in its investment banking and capital markets division  according to a memo obtained by IFR.

column3: MOVES-Varvel to head Credit Suisse asset management
column4: LONDON  May 10 (IFR) - Credit Suisse has appointed Eric Varvel as global head of asset management within the international wealth management division  effective June 1.

column3: Credit Suisse's Swiss and wealth units to run asset management
column4: ZURICH Credit Suisse  is placing asset management under the twin direction of its wealth management and Swiss banking divisions  it said on Sunday  announcing a further strategy rejig after a shake-up in October.

column3: Credit Suisse cuts 130 equities  FICC staff in London
column4: LONDON  May 4 (IFR) - Credit Suisse is cutting about 130 staff in its global markets business in London  a person familiar with the matter said  part of its attempt to cut costs and streamline its business.

column3: Credit Suisse's Thiam faces shareholder ire at AGM
column4: ZURICH Credit Suisse's  leadership came under fire on Friday from shareholders disgruntled by a share slide amid a major restructuring of Switzerland's second-biggest bank.

column3: MOVES-Credit Suisse  Vontobel Wealth Management  AXA
column4: April 27 The following financial services industry appointments were announced on Wednesday. To inform us of other job changes  email moves@thomsonreuters.com.

column3: Glass Lewis tells Credit Suisse investors to reject pay packages: paper
column4: VIENNA Proxy adviser Glass Lewis has recommended shareholders in Credit Suisse  reject the amount of remuneration set for the bank's management and board members  Swiss newspaper NZZ am Sonntag reported.

column3: UPDATE 1-Credit Suisse looks at covering risks with insurance bond - source
column4: ZURICH/LONDON  April 22 Credit Suisse  is trying to offload some of the risk it faces from events such as rogue trading and cybercrime by issuing a new type of insurance bond  a source familiar with the matter said on Friday.

column3: MOVES-Credit Suisse hires ex-Deutsche Bank M&A chief Aslaksen
column4: LONDON  April 20 (IFR) - Credit Suisse has hired Henrik Aslaksen  who was one of Deutsche Bank's top investment bankers for a decade until he left last year.

column3: Credit Suisse's Thiam dons hat and cape to join Swiss spring parade
column4: ZURICH Credit Suisse's Tidjane Thiam  under pressure after a more than 40 percent fall in the bank's share price since taking over  tried to win over the Swiss public on Monday by donning a cape to march in one of Switzerland's most festive traditions.

column3: Credit Suisse's Thiam dons hat and cape to join Swiss spring parade
column4: ZURICH  April 18 Credit Suisse's  Tidjane Thiam  under pressure after a more than 40 percent fall in the bank's share price since taking over  tried to win over the Swiss public on Monday by donning a cape to march in one of Switzerland's most festive traditions.

column3: UPDATE 1-Japan securities watchdog recommends punishment of Credit Suisse unit
column4: TOKYO  April 15 Japan's securities watchdog on Friday recommended a Japanese unit of Credit Suisse Group AG  be punished after ruling that the brokerage provided information to clients without using the required internal clearance channels.

column3: MOVES-Credit Suisse says Americas chairman Shafir to leave bank
column4: ZURICH  April 14 Credit Suisse's  chairman for the Americas region  Robert Shafir  will leave the Swiss bank in July  a spokeswoman said on Thursday.

column3: Credit Suisse CEO on right track  board needs work - Harris
column4: ZURICH  April 13 Credit Suisse Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam is taking the right steps by shrinking investment banking to focus on wealth management  a senior official at Harris Associates  which holds a 4.2 percent stake  told a Swiss newspaper.

column3: Credit Suisse sends memo to employees ahead of EU referendum
column4: April 7 Credit Suisse Group AG asked its employees not to take part in activities that could promote a particular outcome ahead of the June 23 referendum on Britain's membership of the European Union  according to a memo seen by Reuters.

column3: UPDATE 1-Credit Suisse to cut jobs at Brazil fixed-income unit-Bbg
column4: April 6 Credit Suisse Group AG is laying off nine executives in its fixed-income business in Brazil amid an industry slump  Bloomberg reported  citing people with knowledge of the matter.

column3: MOVES-Credit Suisse bulks up with senior FIG hire - memo

column4: March 29 UBS Group AG has named Joseph Hershberger a vice chairman in its financial institutions group  where he will focus on global asset management efforts  according to a memo seen by Reuters.

column3: Credit Suisse to pay $29 million in U.S. regulator's mortgage case

column3: Credit Suisse head of global macro strategy to leave: memo
column4: LONDON Sean Shepley  head of global macro product strategy at Credit Suisse  is set to leave the bank  according to a memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday  as the Swiss bank steps up its restructuring plan.

column3: U.S. orders Credit Suisse to pay $665 000 over wheat futures

column3: Ex-Georgia premier files Swiss complaint against Credit Suisse
column4: ZURICH Lawyers for former Georgia Prime Minister Bidzina Ivanishvili have filed a Swiss criminal complaint against Credit Suisse relating to allegations of money laundering  one of the lawyers told Reuters on Wednesday.

column3: CRH sees big U.S. infrastructure boost regardless of Trump plans

column3: Shares in Aeromexico plunge on fears of Delta alliance complications

column3: Delta's UK woes signal tougher times for airlines' trans-Atlantic business

column3: Former Delta fuel executive  wife banned by CME

column3: Former Delta Air fuel executive  wife banned from CME markets

column3: Efforts to cut U.S. airport security delays not sustainable: American Airlines CEO
column4: NEW YORK Airlines' efforts to help the U.S. government manage long airport security lines are not sustainable  the chief executive of American Airlines Group Inc said in an interview.

column3: UPDATE 2-Bombardier sees more CSeries jet deals after Delta

column3: Exxon Mobil preparing to put Montana refinery on block: sources

column3: GM  Ford shares could surge at least 25 pct -Barron's

column3: GM sees U.S. market share stabilizing despite cut in fleet

column3: Goldman Sachs to pay $120 million over attempted ISDAFIX benchmark manipulation
column4: WASHINGTON Goldman Sachs Group Inc  will pay a $120 million penalty to resolve civil charges that it attempted to manipulate a global benchmark for interest rate products known on Wall Street as "ISDAFIX " U.S. derivatives regulators said Wednesday.

column4: NEW YORK  Dec 16 Goldman Sachs Group Inc  has agreed to pay $56.5 million to resolve a U.S. class action lawsuit accusing it and other banks of rigging an interest rate benchmark used in the $553 trillion derivatives market.

column3: Goldman sees 'bullish' environment for copper through 1H17

column3: Goldman names 84 new members to partner class  six more than prior group

The latest induction will bring the total number of partners to around 484  or 1.4 percent of Goldman's work force.

column3: Breakingviews: Goldman left with long-term greedy as only option

column3: Goldman Sachs pays CEO Blankfein $22.6 million for 2015
column4: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  paid Chief Executive Lloyd Blankfein $22.6 million for 2015  according to a regulatory filing on Friday  marking his first pay decline in four years.

column3: JPMorgan  Goldman selling 700 million Saipem shares: traders
column4: MILAN JPMorgan  and Goldman Sachs are leading the sale of 700 million shares in Italian oil contractor Saipem   two traders said on Monday.

column3: UPDATE 1-JPMorgan follows competition with richer cash-back credit card
column4: NEW YORK  Feb 29 JPMorgan Chase & Co  will offer a richer cash-back credit card in April to better compete against products from Capital One Financial Corp  and Citigroup Inc.

column3: Trader's ouster at JP Morgan affirms commitment to compliance
column4: NEW YORK  Feb 29 (IFR) - JP Morgan has swiftly severed ties with a top bond trader who circumvented its compliance procedures earlier this year as the bank moves to reinforce its commitment to risk management.

column3: Up to $430 bln in yuan bonds may join EM index in future-JPMorgan
column4: LONDON  Feb 25 Up to $430 billion of yuan bonds could join JPMorgan's widely used emerging currency debt index once some key regulatory hurdles are scrapped  giving China a 10 percent weight in the benchmark  the bank said.

column3: RPT-MOVES-JPMorgan names David Owen new chief administrative officer -memo
column4: NEW YORK  Feb 24 JPMorgan Chase & Co has named David Owen  its current chief financial officer for Consumer & Community Banking  to be chief administrative officer for the entire bank  according to a company memo distributed on Wednesday and seen by Reuters.

column3: JPMorgan signals rough first quarter as trading flags  energy woes deepen
column4: NEW YORK JPMorgan Chase & Co  signalled a rough first quarter on Tuesday with double-digit declines in investment banking revenues and a $500 million increase in provisions for expected losses on energy loans.

column3: BRIEF-JPMorgan boosts stake in China's Sinopharm Group
column4: * JPMorgan Chase acquired H-shares of Sinopharm Group worth HK$3 billion  ($386.23 million) on Feb 15  taking stake to 20.9 percent from 11.5 percent - HKEx filing

column3: MOVES-JP Morgan  Davy Asset Management  China Minsheng Financial
column4: Feb 18 The following financial services industry appointments were announced on Thursday. To inform us of other job changes  email moves@thomsonreuters.com.

column3: JPMorgan's Dimon buys more than $25 million of company stock
column4: NEW YORK Jamie Dimon  chief executive officer of JPMorgan Chase & Co   on Thursday bought 500 000 shares of the company's stock for more than $25 million  according to a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

column3: JPMorgan's Dimon buys more than $25 mln company stock -source
column4: NEW YORK  Feb 11 Jamie Dimon  chief executive officer of JPMorgan Chase & Co  recently bought 500 000 shares of the company's stock worth more than $25 million  according to a person familiar with the matter.

column3: Central banks can cut rates well below zero  says JP Morgan
column4: LONDON Investors fretting about the damaging impact of ultra-cheap money on banks and global markets may need to prepare for key interest rates around the world falling well below zero  according to economists at JP Morgan.

column3: MOVES-Credit Suisse  JPMorgan  Peel Hunt  KBL European
column4: Feb 9 The following financial services industry appointments were announced on Tuesday. To inform us of other job changes  email moves@thomsonreuters.com.

column3: Amazon renews credit card deal with JPMorgan
column4: Amazon.com Inc  the world's No. 1 online retailer  has renewed its long-running credit card relationship with JPMorgan Chase & Co  a spokesman for Amazon said on Thursday.

column3: JPMorgan launches blockchain trial project: FT
column4: JPMorgan Chase is partnering with start-up Digital Asset Holdings to launch a trial project using blockchain technology that could reduce the cost and complexity of trading  the Financial Times reported on Sunday.

column3: MOVES-Barclays hires JPMorgan's Venkatakrishnan as Chief Risk Officer
column4: LONDON  Jan 29 Barclays has appointed JPMorgan Chase & Co's C.S. Venkatakrishnan as its Chief Risk Officer  the bank said on Friday  the latest in a series of JPMorgan alumni to join the British lender.

column3: J.P. Morgan to cut Argentina from NEXGEM frontier index
column4: LONDON Argentina will be cut from J.P. Morgan's frontier debt index on Friday due to its large weighting  but could see its weight in the bank's benchmark hard-currency emerging market debt index increase if Buenos Aires issues fresh debt  the bank said.

column3: Lead objector to $4.5 bln JPMorgan mortgage settlement withdraws
column4: Bond insurer Ambac Assurance Corporation on Tuesday withdrew its objections to JPMorgan Chase & Co's proposed $4.5 billion settlement with investors in soured residential mortgage backed securities  paving the way for court approval of the deal.

column3: JPMorgan to pay $1.42 bln cash to settle most Lehman claims
column4: NEW YORK JPMorgan Chase & Co will pay $1.42 billion in cash to resolve most of a lawsuit accusing it of draining Lehman Brothers Holdings Inc of critical liquidity in the final days before that investment bank's September 2008 collapse.

column3: BUZZ-Lloyds: JP Morgan cuts PT
column4: ** Lloyds down c.2 pct after JP Morgan cuts PT on stock to 90p from 98p  keeps "over-weight" rating

column3: JPMorgan raises Dimon's pay 35 percent  but adds strings
column4: NEW YORK JPMorgan Chase & Co  directors raised Chief Executive Jamie Dimon's total compensation by 35 percent to $27 million for 2015  a regulatory filing on Thursday showed.

column3: Denmark's NKT hires JP Morgan to look at divestment - paper
column4: COPENHAGEN  Jan 20 Danish industrial company NKT Holding has hired U.S. investment bank JP Morgan  to assess the possibilities of divesting its largest business unit NKT Cables  Danish newspaper Jyllands-Posten reported on Wednesday  citing anonymous sources.

column3: Saudi's Savola Group says hires JP Morgan's Fayez as CEO
column4: DUBAI  Jan 19 Saudi Arabia's largest food products company Savola Group said it appointed JP Morgan's Rayan Mohammed Fayez as chief executive  it said in a bourse filing on Tuesday.

column3: BRIEF-JP Morgan trims long position in Telecom Italia
column4: Jan 15 A filing with Italian market regulator Consob shows:

column3: JPMorgan strikes confident tone after better-than-expected results
column4: JPMorgan Chase & Co  ended the year with a better-than-expected quarterly profit  helped by cost cuts and a smaller legal bill  and expressed confidence about its businesses in 2016 despite a grim start for stocks and energy prices. | Video

column3: Goldman  JPMorgan  Glencore defeat U.S. lawsuit over zinc prices
column4: A U.S. judge on Thursday dismissed a private antitrust lawsuit in which zinc purchasers accused affiliates of Goldman Sachs Group Inc   JPMorgan Chase & Co  and Glencore Plc  of conspiring to drive up the metal's price.

column3: JPMorgan to pay $4 mln for false statements about broker pay -SEC
column4: Jan 6 JP Morgan Chase & Co's brokerage unit will pay $4 million to settle allegations it misled customers about how it paid brokers  the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Wednesday.

column3: JPMorgan names Virtu Financial as its NYSE market maker
column4: JPMorgan Chase & Co  said on Tuesday it appointed Virtu Financial Inc  as its market maker on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.

column3: Exclusive: J&J discussing breaking up Actelion in an acquisition - sources
column4: Johnson & Johnson  is negotiating a deal to acquire Swiss biotechnology company Actelion Ltd  that would separate its commercialized portfolio from its research and development assets  people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

column3: Actelion re-enters talks with J&J  sidelining Sanofi
column4: ZURICH/FRANKFURT Swiss biotech company Actelion  has turned back to prospective bidder Johnson & Johnson  for exclusive talks about a "strategic transaction"  in an about-turn that appears to sideline rival suitor Sanofi . | Video

column3: Pfizer's Xtandi fails in progression trial vs. J&J's Zytiga
column4: A late-stage trial found that continuing treatment with Pfizer Inc's cancer drug Xtandi in addition to a regimen of Zytiga and a steroid worked no better than the two other drugs alone in patients with advanced prostate cancer whose disease had worsened  the company said on Wednesday.

column3: Johnson & Johnson shares could rally about 20 percent: Barron's
column4: NEW YORK Johnson & Johnson  shares could rally about 20 percent to the mid-$130s as operating improvements spur earnings growth  Barron's said in a report.

column3: J&J questions fairness of hip implant trial  $1 billion verdict
column4: Johnson & Johnson  will challenge the fairness of a trial that produced a verdict of $1 billion in damages against the company last week over allegations of design flaws in its  Pinnacle hip implant.

column3: Top Actelion shareholder says backs J&J deal above 246 Sfr/share
column4: LONDON A top-30 investor in Swiss pharmaceutical company Actelion  said he would back a takeover approach for the whole company from U.S. rival Johnson & Johnson  above 246 Swiss francs.

column3: Actelion's silence has hedge funds betting big on J&J deal
column4: ZURICH Actelion's silence speaks volumes to the dozens of event-driven hedge funds piling into the Swiss biotech firm  betting that Johnson & Johnson's (J&J)  approach will result in an outright takeover and handsome returns.

column3: Actelion shares fall on report it rejects J&J offer
column4: ZURICH Shares in Swiss biotech company Actelion fell more than 6 percent after news outlet streetinsider.com reported on Wednesday the company had rejected a full takeover offer by U.S. healthcare group Johnson & Johnson and may sell a unit.

column3: Deals of the day-Mergers and acquisitions
column4: Nov 29 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2100 GMT on Tuesday:

column3: Biotech group Actelion  Johnson & Johnson confirm deal talks
column4: ZURICH/FRANKFURT U.S. healthcare company Johnson & Johnson said on Friday it was in preliminary talks with Actelion about a potential takeover of Europe's largest biotech firm  currently valued at about $20 billion.

column3: BRIEF-J&J confirms discussions with Actelion regarding potential deal
column4: * Johnson & Johnson confirms discussions with Actelion regarding potential transaction

column3: J&J makes takeover approach for Swiss drugmaker Actelion -Bloomberg
column4: Nov 24 U.S. healthcare company Johnson & Johnson  has approached Swiss biotechnology firm Actelion Ltd  about a potential takeover  Bloomberg reported on Thursday  citing people it said were familiar with the matter.

column3: BRIEF-Paulson & Co cuts share stake in Alexion Pharmaceuticals  Johnson & Johnson
column4: * Paulson & Co cuts share stake in Alexion Pharmaceuticals Inc by 15.0 percent to 227 700 shares

column3: J&J vaccine plus Gilead immune booster shows promise as HIV fighter
column4: CHICAGO An experimental HIV vaccine from Johnson & Johnson combined with an immune system booster from Gilead Sciences Inc showed promise at keeping the virus at bay in monkeys even after treatments had stopped  marking yet another step toward the development of a so-called functional cure for HIV.

column3: BRIEF-British artificial intelligence firm announces license agreement with Janssen
column4: * British artificial intelligence firm announces exclusive license agreement with Janssen for clinical stage drug candidates  facilitated by Johnson & Johnson innovation

column3: Analysis: After $195 mln in talc verdicts  J&J strives to change court
column4: After a $67.5 million jury verdict against Johnson & Johnson on Oct. 27 marked its third straight trial defeat in an onslaught of lawsuits claiming its talc-based products cause ovarian cancer  the company is hoping to reverse the trend by having the cases heard in a different court.

column3: After $195 million in talc verdicts  J&J strives to change court
column4: After a $67.5 million jury verdict against Johnson & Johnson  on Oct. 27 marked its third straight trial defeat in an onslaught of lawsuits claiming its talc-based products cause ovarian cancer  the company is hoping to reverse the trend by having the cases heard in a different court.

column3: J&J shares lose ground on fears of Pfizer's answer to Remicade
column4: Booming pharmaceutical sales drove strong quarterly results for Johnson & Johnson   but the company's shares fell more than 2 percent on worries that its blockbuster Remicade arthritis drug would soon face cheaper competition.

column3: Pfizer to start shipping biosimilar version of J&J's Remicade in November
column4: Pfizer Inc  said on Monday it will begin shipping its biosimilar version of Johnson & Johnson's  blockbuster rheumatoid arthritis drug Remicade in late November at a 15 percent discount to current wholesale prices.

column3: Special Report: How Fidelity's owners get richer at everyday investors' expense
column4: BOSTON (Due to inaccurate data in Fidelity's original filing  this October 5 story corrects to show that Fidelity's venture arm's investment in Adaptimmune rose to $41 million  not $270 million; that Fidelity Select Biotechnology Portfolio paid at least four times more than rivals for shares  not 24 times; and that the venture arm got its Adaptimmune shares for about $3.54 each  not 59 cents each.)

column3: J&J warns diabetic patients: Insulin pump vulnerable to hacking
column4: Johnson & Johnson is telling patients that it has learned of a security vulnerability in one of its insulin pumps that a hacker could exploit to overdose diabetic patients with insulin  though it describes the risk as low.

column3: Morphosys moves closer to getting first antibody drug on market
column4: FRANKFURT German biotech Morphosys moved a step closer to getting its first antibody drug onto the market as its licensee  Johnson & Johnson unit Jenssen  reported positive results from a phase 3 study of psoriasis drug guselkumab.

column3: FDA approves J&J's autoimmune drug Stelara for Crohn's disease
column4: Johnson & Johnson said on Monday that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved the company's blockbuster psoriasis drug  Stelara  for use in adults with Crohn's disease.

column3: Abbott to sell its eye care business to J&J for about $4.33 billion
column4: Abbott Laboratories  said it would sell its eye care business to Johnson & Johnson  for about $4.33 billion in cash to focus on cardiovascular devices and diagnostics business.

column3: New MDL sought for cases over J&J talc powder and ovarian cancer
column4: A federal judicial panel has been asked to consolidate nearly a dozen lawsuits filed in U.S. federal courts alleging Johnson & Johnson failed to warn women that using its talc-based powders for feminine hygiene could increase their risk of ovarian cancer.

column3: Johnson & Johnson raises 2016 forecast  shares touch record high
column4: Johnson & Johnson  on Tuesday raised its full-year 2016 sales and earnings forecasts and reported quarterly results that beat  estimates  helped by strength in its prescription drugs business.

column4: * Johnson & Johnson announces completion of acquisition of Vogue International Llc  Source text for Eikon:  Further company coverage:    (Bengaluru Newsroom: +1-646-223-8780)
